articleinfo.title: Fedict eID Digital Signature Service Administrator Manual

abstract.para: This manual serves as an entry point for setting up the eID Digital Signature Service. The target audience is system administrators.

section.title: Introduction
section.para: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document (in uppercase, as shown) are to be interpreted as described in [RFC2119] .

The eID Digital Signature Service provides three major service artifacts:
eID Digital Signature Service portal
Via this web portal citizens can sign document and verify signatures on documents.
eID Digital Signature Service signature validation web service.
Via this SOAP web service Relying Parties (aka Service Providers) can verify signatures on documents. This web service is constructed according to the OASIS DSS web service standard.
The eID DSS signature creation portal.
Via this portal Relying Parties can create signatures on documents.
Besides these two service artifacts, the eID DSS also comes with an Admin portal that allows administrators to manage the eID DSS via an easy to use web portal interface. In the following sections we will use $EID_DSS_ADDRESS as the (internal) web address where the eID DSS product has been deployed.

The source code of the Fedict eID Digital Signature Service is publicly available and can be found at eID Digital Signature Service Source Code . Please note that the Fedict eID DSS has dependencies on the eID Trust Service product, which can be found at eID Trust Service source code .

section.title: Installation
section.para: The eID Digital Signature Service JBoss distribution is based on the eID Trust Service JBoss distribution. This means that all generic eID Trust Service configuration is also applicable to the eID Digital Signature Service. We refer to the eID Trust Service Administrator Manual for all non eID DSS specific configuration aspects.

The eID Digital Signature Service distribution also bundles the eID Trust Service. If you do not want to deploy the eID Trust Service along with the eID Digital Signature Service you can remove the following files from the distribution:
jboss/server/default/deploy/eid-trust-service-deploy-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.ear
jboss/server/all/deploy/eid-trust-service-deploy-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.ear

section.title: Database
section.para:
The eID Digital Signature Service comes with distributions for the following database products:
MySQL
PostgreSQL
Oracle

section.title: MySQL
section.para: The database initialization is similar to that of the eID Trust Service product. The eID Digital Signature Service specific database initialization script is called eid-dss-ddl-mysql.sql and is located under the sql directory.

section.title: PostgreSQL
section.para: The database initialization is similar to that of the eID Trust Service product. The eID Digital Signature Service specific database initialization script is called eid-dss-ddl-postgresql.sql and is located under the sql directory.

section.title: Oracle
section.para: The database initialization is similar to that of the eID Trust Service product. The eID Digital Signature Service specific database initialization script is called eid-dss-ddl-oracle.sql and is located under the sql directory.

section.title: Deployment
section.para: Deploy the eID Digital Signature Service the same way you deploy the eID Trust Service.

section.title: eID DSS Admin Portal
section.para:
The eID Digital Signature Service Administrator Portal is available at $EID_DSS_ADDRESS/eid-dss-admin-portal/ . After deployment of the eID Digital Signature Service you should register an administrator by logging in into the admin portal. In this admin portal you should at least configure the following under PKI Validation :
eID Trust Service XKMS2 URL. For example https://www.e-contract.be/eid-trust-service-ws/xkms2
Signature creation trust domain: BE
Signature verification trust domain: BE
TSA trust domain: BE-TSA
Under TSP you should configure the time-stamp service used by the eID DSS to create its XAdES-T and XAdES-X signatures.
TSP server URL: http://tsa.belgium.be/connect

section.title: eID DSS Core
section.para: The eID Digital Signature Service core is available at: $EID_DSS_ADDRESS/eid-dss/ . Check this site to find out which document formats and signature protocols are provided by the eID DSS runtime.

section.title: eID DSS Validation Web Service
section.para: The eID Digital Signature Service Validation Web Service is available at: $EID_DSS_ADDRESS/eid-dss-ws/dss . Check this site to see whether the JAX-WS webservice stack is up and running.

section.title: eID DSS Portal
section.para: The eID Digital Signature Service end-user portal is available at: $EID_DSS_ADDRESS/eid-dss-portal/ . After configuring the eID DSS via the eID DSS admin portal, try to sign a document using this portal.
